summary: The Synthetic Biology Advancement Act of 2025 aims to establish a National Synthetic Biology Center to award grants for research into synthetic biology applications in food and agriculture. The Center, overseen by the Secretary of Agriculture, will fund projects focused on improving agricultural performance, minimizing environmental impact, and enhancing food system resilience. Grants will be awarded on a competitive basis to eligible institutions, with research priorities including cellular biology, gene editing, and digital agriculture. The act also outlines reporting requirements and authorizes appropriations for the Center's establishment and grant programs.
